page.title: 15LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: Local people spend their leisure time indoors in a number of ways. A third of the adults enjoy reading, a quarter relax in practical leisure such as knitting, sewing and do-it-yourself and a further quarter spend their leisure time watching television, using computers and listening to the radio. The old people can go to the Monday Centre at the Village Hall where they can chat to their friends. The main outdoor leisure activities are gardening and walking. Gardeners work on allotments at the top of the village and there are beautiful walks all round the village. Some groups spend their evenings at the pub where they talk and play pool, billiards, darts and dominoes. Over half of the families have seaside holidays: a quarter prefer to stay locally. Emma Pickworth (11)
